thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: CLASS 4A ROUNDUPS

title: CLASS 4A ROUNDUPS
text:
Senior Jordan Canty returned an interception for another score for the Pirates, who also got a Ryan Anderson rushing touchdown. 
GRAVETTE 22, PEA RIDGE 12 
PEA RIDGE — Jordan Burnett ran for 125 yards and two touchdowns as Gravette (4-2, 1-1 1-4A) defeated Pea Ridge (4-1, 2-1) to end the Blackhawks’ 15-game regular-season winning streak. Quarterback Bryce Moorman gave Gravette a 15-6 lead with a 36-yard touchdown pass to Jackson Soule. The senior was 12 of 14 passing for 131 yards and 1 touchdown. Soule finished with seven catches for 85 yards. 
Zaine Holley led Pea Ridge with 95 yards rushing on 27 carries. 
PRAIRIE GROVE 62, 
SHILOH CHRISTIAN 33 
PRAIRIE GROVE — Blake Faulk carried 13 times for 149 yards and 3 touchdowns as Prairie Grove (5-1, 3-0 1-4A) defeated Shiloh Christian (3-2, 2-1) at Tiger Stadium. 
Faulk also had 2 receptions for 74 yards and 1 touchdown, a 64-yard strike from Sam Dodd on the second play of the game that gave Prairie Grove an 8-0 lead with 11:06 left in the first quarter. Faulk’s touchdown runs covered 39, 22 and 16 yards. Dodd also hit Reed Orr with a screen pass that Orr turned into a 56-yard touchdown, and Isaac Disney returned a kickoff 85 yards for another Prairie Grove score. 
2-4A 
CENTRAL ARK. CHRISTIAN 48, HEBER SPRINGS 12 
HEBER SPRINGS — Noah Evans threw a 31-yard touchdown pass to Hunter Corbell in the first quarter and Central Arkansas Christian (5-1, 3-0 2-4A) never looked back against Heber Springs (2-4, 1-2), which played one week after the team was involved in a bus accident on the way home from Stuttgart. 
Evans added a second touchdown in the second quarter on a 66-yard pass to Joshua Johnson. Braylon Harris rushed for two touchdowns including a 46-yard score, and Kamryn Vick also had a rushing touchdown for the Mustangs. 
CAC’s Shane Almond returned an interception 20 yards for a touchdown and Zac Otwell recovered a Heber Springs fumble in the end zone for a score. 
STUTTGART 55, NEWPORT 25 
NEWPORT — Kirk Hughes rushed 19 times for 183 yards and 4 touchdowns to lead Stuttgart (4-2, 3-0) to a 2-4A Conference victory over Newport (1-5, 1-2). Michael Smith completed 3 of 8 passes for 130 yards and 2 touchdowns, and Darius Irving returned a punt 55 yards for a touchdown and a kickoff 74 yards for another score. 
Tydnell Friar threw a 31-yard touchdown pass to Darrin Moore and rushed for two more scores to lead Newport. The Greyhounds’ Darrien Roddy also returned a kickoff 74 yards for another touchdown. 
3-4A 
GOSNELL 46, TRUMANN 12 
TRUMANN — Senior running back Carlos Blackman scored four touchdowns as Gosnell (5-0, 3-0) rolled to a 3-4A conference victory over Trumann (4-2, 1-2). 
Senior Jordan Canty returned an interception for another score for the Pirates, who also got a Ryan Anderson rushing touchdown. 
POCAHONTAS 48, 
BROOKLAND 14 
POCAHONTAS — Reese Coates rushed 8 times for 109 yards and 2 touchdowns to help lift Pocahontas (6-0, 3-0 3-4A) over Brookland (1-5, 1-2). 
Josiah Marlow added 3 carries for 90 yards and 2 more touchdowns, while Travis Riley added 50 yards and another score on 6 carries. 
Coates scored on a 41-yard run in the first quarter and a 2-yard run in the third. Marlow scored on a 36-yard run and a 44-yard run. Wiley added an 11-yard touchdown run. 
4-4A 
DOVER 38 CLINTON 3 
DOVER — Luke Price had 13 carries for 121 yards and two touchdowns and passed for another score as Dover (5-1, 2-1) defeated Clinton ( 1-5, 0-3) in a 4-4A Conference game. 
John Srutka added 14 carries for 138 yards and 1 touchdown, and Seth Cheak kicked an 18-yard field goal for the Pirates. 
Price scored on a 39-yard yard run and a 2-yard run before connecting with Frank Flores on a 29-yard touchdown pass. Srutka scored on a 76-yard run. Kaleb Fondren led Dover’s defense with 18 tackles. 
7-4A 
FOUNTAIN LAKE 35, 
ARKADELPHIA 13 
ARKADELPHIA — Parker Ross rushed for 179 yards and a pair of second-half touchdowns, and Adrias Turner added three 1-yard touchdown scoring runs, leading Fountain Lake to a 7-4A Conference victory Friday night at Badger Stadium. 
Fountain Lake (4-2, 2-1) shut out Arkadelphia (2-4, 1-2) for three quarters, taking a 14-0 lead into the final period before the Cobras broke out for 21 points. On the Cobras’ first play from scrimmage in the fourth, Ross broke a 51-yard touchdown run for 21-0 edge. 
Getting another stop on Tanner Tedford’s 11-yard sack of Jeff Blake, the Cobras got the ball in Badger territory. On the fourth play of the series, Ross broke loose for a 32-yard touchdown run. 
Arkadelphia finally got on the board with 6:06 left on Tajhan Mckenzie’s 4-yard run,. But Chance Wilson broke a 39-yard run after Fountain Lake recovered the onside kick, and Turner scored for a 35-7 lead at the 4:56 mark. 
A big return on the kickoff by Nate Jones set up Jeff Blake’s 26-yard TD run with 4:09 left to set the final margin. 
8-4A 
PINE BLUFF DOLLARWAY 32, 
MONTICELLO 26 
PINE BLUFF — Pine Bluff Dollarway (5-1, 3-0 8-4A) held off Monticello (2-4, 0-3) behind the rushing attack of Simeon Blair and Markell Scott. 
Monticello led 13-6 at halftime after Jeff Carmical threw two touchdown passes, including an 80-yard scoring throw to Scott Bratton. 
Dollarway scored twice in the third quarter, including an 8-yard run by Scott. Dollarway scored two more touchdowns in the fourth quarter, one coming by Blair. 
(Advertisement)
